title: Our lovely neighbor
body:
I try not to talk much about my life outside of the theater on this blog, but this is too good to pass up. Do you remember the little "side note" in the mid-July update about my neighbor who is currently being investigated by the feds? Well, here's a nice little article about her from the office of Missouri's Secretary of State. Pretty cool, eh?

We ran into her yesterday as we were coming home from work. Nicole said "hello" out of rote politeness, and our neighbor rolled her eyes. She's a real winner.
author: Dan

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Yep. It was Nicole's iPod actually... our neighbor returned it right before I called the cops. I should've called anyways.

comments.author: Newell
comments.body: Man... investment fraud and grand theft iPod. Where does it end???

comments.author: whit
comments.body: Maybe she could help out with your fundraising?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Right. I have a feeling she's already sniffed the majority of the money up her nose... or injected it between her toes.

comments.author: Tim
comments.body:
Really? But how could she...

...ooohhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

Seriously though, you should ask if she wants to invest in the Moxie, just to watch her go ballistic.

comments.author: Amy
comments.body: Where does a swindler get off rolling her eyes at an honest, hard-working person trying to get there dream business up and running? Maybe next time Nicole should ask her if she's talked to the feds lately or if she's going to be roommates with Martha Stewart or "How's that scam paying off for you?" Something like that.

comments.author: Amy
comments.body: Oops. In my previous post I used "there" when I should have used "their". I sincerely apologize.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I daydream about saying lots of mean things to her, none of which are suitable for this blog lest I incur a sudden influx of traffic for the search terms "filthy whore", "nickel", and "zipper".

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Amy, you should be ashamed of yourself.

comments.author: Luke
comments.body:
I have to say that is one of the lamest schemes I've ever heard of.

"This is the dumbest shakedown in the history of dumb shakedowns."
-Jack Foley
Out of Sight

comments.author: Luke
comments.body:
Also, Dan thanks for checking out my site the other day.

Sorry to get you fired though.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Luke, don't worry about getting me fired. I never liked that job anyway.

comments.author: sandra
comments.body: it's always nice to have something (juicy) to write home about.
